titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William Everard Gardiner Transportation Collection M0326

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-04-21 10:12:25 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.abstract: Collection of photographs and research material concerning railroads, street cars and other public transportation in and around Oakland and Berkeley, California.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], William Everard Gardiner Transportation Collection (M0326). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Note that material must be requested at least 36 hours in advance of intended use. Photograph negatives are not available.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: While Special Collections is the owner of the physical and digital items, permission to examine collection materials is not an authorization to publish. These materials are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. Any transmission or reproduction beyond that allowed by fair use requires permission from the owners of rights, heir(s) or assigns.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of photographs and research material concerning railroads, street cars and other public transportation in and around Oakland and Berkeley, California from historian and local railway employee William Everard Gardiner (1869-1949). Born in Cedar County, Iowa, Gardiner worked for the San Francisco-Oakland Terminal Railways and later the Key System (which took over the SF-O Terminal Railways in 1924). He was Chief Instructor and Superintendent of Schedules through at least 1928.

Gardiner was an early member of the Pacific Railway Club (est. 1917) and Railway and Locomotive Historical Society (est. 1925). He was also a photographer, and the collection contains negatives and prints made by him, along with reproductions of older images. Some of the photographs by Gardiner document the 1906 earthquakeâ€™s effects in Berkeley. There is also information on the general history of Alameda County.

The collection contains photographs, manuscripts & typescripts on history (some transcribed), correspondence, newspaper & magazine clippings (primarily 1920s Oakland Tribune articles), ephemera including many examples of train tickets, scrapbooks, and other material. Gardiner material may be present in other Stanford transportation collections; likewise other material may have been added to the Gardiner collection in the past.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Some prints are reproductions or published real photograph postcards. However, several have an embossed stamp identifying Gardiner as photographer. There is also a substantial amount of textual material in the scrapbooks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: transcribed excerpts from Janes' Ilustrated History of the University of California ; Oakland Tribune article on Oakland's first school house, June 1921 ; Six photos (some missing): University of California, DeLuxe Coach, DeLuxe Station, Hayward, Clay St. Hill Railroad, San Francisco

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: California Missions (published photo postcards with captions) ; Oakland photos: church, City Hall Plaza, Hotel Alta, Old Webster St. Bridge approach ; Other: Key Ferry "Fernwood," AT&SF Railroad, 1700 Series at Cajon Pass

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Aerial views of city and harbor ; photos of streets and buildings ; Oakland streetcars. 46 photographs: Oakland Inner Harbor 1910 ; 12th St. Dam 1910 ; 14th & Clay c.1909-1910 ; Near City Hall, c. 1910 ; View over Bay to Marin ; Oakland aerial views ; Pr. Richmond, 1912 ; UC Berkeley, aerial view ; Richmond? aerial view ; Crews, Telegraph Ave. Barns ; Leona Heights Car ; Elmhurst Car Barn ; Streetcars ; Broadway and 11th, early 1880s ; City Hall Plaza ; Key System Building ; Horse Car at SF Exhibition, 1915 ; City Hall from Washington St. postcard ; Oakland Mole postcard ; published photographs: Oakland City Hall, Old SP Depot, Road to Trestle Glen

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 16 photos showing effects of earthquake. Most buildings and streets identified in captions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 81 photos (one dated 1904, some older copy prints). Streetcars of Alemeda Oakland & Piedmont Electric Railway, 14th St. RR, O & BRT Co., Oakland, Brooklyn & Fruitvale Railway, Oakland Con. St. Railway, Oakland Transit Co., Oakland, San Leandro & Haywards ; Oakland harbor ; Oakland streets and buildings ; OTC Div. Supt. and Insprctor group portrait ; Time schedules, A,O&P ; Grading of Grand Ave. at Adam's Point ; California Railways - steam ; Unidentified locomototive ; City of Richmond ferry ; unidentified ferries ; Oakland Traction Co. tower truck, 1907, tower wagon 1898 ; unidentified group in bleachers ; unidentifed group with pompoms and megaphone.

Scrapbook also contains SF-Oakland Terminal Railways Chart of Organization 1919, Rate Comparisons 1897-1917 ; Union contracts 1917, 1918, 1920 ; personnel records 1918-1920 ; passenger survey 1914 ; Tariffs 1921

Southern Pacific Bulletin March 1920

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Old but in some cases later prints originally stored with nitrate negatives (which are not available but may be the subject of future digitization). More detailed notes are written on envelopes. There are multiple prints in some cases. Note: prints are extremely brittle and in some cases have already broken.
Some photographs present here were probably not taken or collected by Gardiner and were added to his collection later.
